body_html:
@madhu-sudhan : You can try __android_log_assert and see if you get a fatal crash, then at least your log is getting triggered.

If that works then try "adb logcat -P ''" and relaunch the app, if you still don't see the log, I will suggest first writing a simple Android app with JNI and using that to do Android logging, there are plenty of examples on the web. This will make you familiar with how JNI works on Android. Unfortunately can't help you anymore, without knowing how you are using the code.

body:
@madhu-sudhan : You can try __android_log_assert and see if you get a fatal crash, then at least your log is getting triggered.

If that works then try "adb logcat -P ''" and relaunch the app, if you still don't see the log, I will suggest first writing a simple Android app with JNI and using that to do Android logging, there are plenty of examples on the web. This will make you familiar with how JNI works on Android. Unfortunately can't help you anymore, without knowing how you are using the code.
